invention-noun.title: invention
invention-noun.definition: a new thing or idea that someone has made or thought of.
invention-noun.imageDescription: A bright lightbulb appearing above a creative mind, symbolizing a new idea or product coming into existence.
invention-noun.exampleSentence: The internet was a truly groundbreaking invention that changed how people connect.

unspecified-adjective.title: unspecified
unspecified-adjective.Image Description: A blurry calendar or a clock with no hands, suggesting an unknown or vague moment in time.
unspecified-adjective.example: The meeting is scheduled for an unspecified time next week.

idiom-noun.title: idiom
idiom-noun.description: a group of words whose meaning is not clear from the individual words.
idiom-noun.Image Description: A speech bubble containing a confusing image (like raining cats and dogs) that conveys a figurative meaning, not literal.
idiom-noun.example: "Break a leg" is an idiom used to wish someone good luck, not for actual injury.

boundaries-noun.title: boundaries
boundaries-noun.description: the limits or edges of something, often rules or acceptable behavior.
boundaries-noun.Image Description: A clear line on the ground being stepped over, or a fence being pushed through, symbolizing the breaking of limits.
boundaries-noun.example: It's important to respect personal boundaries in friendships.

acceptable-adjective.title: acceptable
acceptable-adjective.description: good enough; allowed or agreed upon.
acceptable-adjective.Image Description: A hand giving a thumbs-up gesture, or a person nodding in approval, indicating something is within limits or agreeable.
acceptable-adjective.example: Her grades were acceptable, but she hoped to do better next semester.

fresh-adjective.title: fresh
fresh-adjective.description: newly made, gathered, or produced; not old or frozen.
fresh-adjective.Image Description: A close-up of vibrant, dewy vegetables just picked, or dough being kneaded with flour, emphasizing newness and natural state.
fresh-adjective.example: We bought fresh bread from the bakery this morning.

popular-adjective.title: popular
popular-adjective.description: liked or enjoyed by many people.
popular-adjective.Image Description: A large crowd cheering, many hands reaching for something, a widely recognized symbol.
popular-adjective.example: That new song is very popular right now; everyone is listening to it.

origins-noun.title: origins
origins-noun.description: the beginning or source of something.
origins-noun.Image Description: A map with a starting point, roots of a tree, an ancient artifact.
origins-noun.example: The origins of this ancient custom are still unknown.

recipes-noun.title: recipes
recipes-noun.description: sets of instructions for making food.
recipes-noun.Image Description: An open cookbook with ingredients laid out, someone following cooking instructions.
recipes-noun.example: My grandmother has many old recipes for delicious cakes.

spread-verb.title: spread
spread-verb.description: to move or make something move over a wide area.
spread-verb.Image Description: A hand scattering seeds, ripples in water, a map with expanding arrows.
spread-verb.example: The news of the discovery quickly spread around the world.

traders-noun.title: traders
traders-noun.description: people who buy and sell things.
traders-noun.Image Description: Merchants in a bustling marketplace, a caravan on a trade route, people exchanging goods.
traders-noun.example: In ancient times, traders traveled long distances to exchange goods.

destination-noun.title: destination
destination-noun.description: the place you are going to.
destination-noun.Image Description: A signpost pointing a way, a train arriving at a station, a pinpoint on a map.
destination-noun.example: After a long journey, we finally arrived at our tropical destination.

flavour-noun.title: flavour
flavour-noun.description: the special taste of a food or drink.
flavour-noun.Image Description: Steam rising from a delicious dish, spices in a bowl, a taste bud on a tongue.
flavour-noun.example: This ice cream has a rich chocolate flavour.

ingredients-noun.title: ingredients
ingredients-noun.description: the foods or items used to make a dish or product.
ingredients-noun.Image Description: Various items laid out on a kitchen counter before cooking, bowls of spices and chopped vegetables.
ingredients-noun.example: All the ingredients for the cake are in the cupboard.

varieties-noun.title: varieties
varieties-noun.description: different kinds or types of something.
varieties-noun.Image Description: A diverse collection of items, different colors of the same object, multiple pathways.
varieties-noun.example: This store sells many varieties of cheese.

investigated-verb.title: investigated
investigated-verb.description: looked into something carefully to find facts or truth.
investigated-verb.Image Description: A detective looking through clues, a scientist examining a sample, a magnifying glass over documents.
investigated-verb.example: The police investigated the cause of the accident.

uncovered-verb.title: uncovered
uncovered-verb.description: found something that was hidden or unknown.
uncovered-verb.Image Description: Lifting a blanket to reveal something, digging up a hidden treasure, pulling back a curtain.
uncovered-verb.example: Researchers uncovered ancient ruins deep in the jungle.

exotic-adjective.title: exotic
exotic-adjective.description: unusual and interesting because it comes from a faraway place.
exotic-adjective.Image Description: A vibrant, colorful bird from a rainforest, a mysterious temple in a distant land, a unique spice from a foreign market.
exotic-adjective.example: We saw many exotic plants at the botanical garden.

association-noun.title: association
association-noun.description: an organized group of people with a shared goal.
association-noun.Image Description: A group of people meeting, a logo of a professional body, interconnected gears.
association-noun.example: She joined a local community association to help improve the neighborhood.

promote-verb.title: promote
promote-verb.description: to help something grow or be successful.
promote-verb.Image Description: A megaphone, a person advertising, a product being displayed prominently.
promote-verb.example: The company launched a new campaign to promote their eco-friendly products.

manufacturing-noun.title: manufacturing
manufacturing-noun.description: the process of making things, especially in large amounts, in a factory.
manufacturing-noun.Image Description: An assembly line, factory smoke stacks, machines producing items.
manufacturing-noun.example: The country is known for its strong auto manufacturing industry.

meaning-verb.title: meaning
meaning-verb.description: explaining what something refers to or what it implies.
meaning-verb.Image Description: A definition in a dictionary, an arrow pointing from a word to its explanation, a thought bubble with clarification.
meaning-verb.example: The word "fast" can refer to speed, meaning quick movement, or to not eating, meaning a period without food.

foreign-adjective.title: foreign
foreign-adjective.Image Description: A passport, a different country's flag, someone speaking an unfamiliar language.
foreign-adjective.example: Learning a foreign language can open up new opportunities.

localise-verb.title: localise
localise-verb.description: to change something to make it suitable for a local area.
localise-verb.Image Description: A world map with a magnifying glass zooming in on a specific region, or a dish being garnished with local ingredients, illustrating adaptation to a new context.
localise-verb.example: The company decided to localise its advertising campaign to fit the culture of each country.

slices-noun.title: slices
slices-noun.description: thin flat pieces cut from something larger.
slices-noun.Image Description: A knife cutting food into thin pieces, evenly cut pieces of bread or meat.
slices-noun.example: Please give me two slices of pizza.

gradually-adverb.title: gradually
gradually-adverb.Image Description: A plant slowly growing, a sunrise over time-lapse, footsteps moving slowly up a hill.
gradually-adverb.example: The weather is gradually getting warmer as summer approaches.

response-noun.title: response
response-noun.description: a reaction or answer to something.
response-noun.Image Description: Ripples spreading outwards in water from a dropped stone, or a person reacting visibly to a piece of news, depicting a consequence or reply.
response-noun.example: Her quiet response showed that she was deep in thought.

traditional-adjective.title: traditional
traditional-adjective.description: following old customs or beliefs that have existed for a long time.
traditional-adjective.Image Description: An old scroll or book, an ancient ceremony, a classic, timeless object.
traditional-adjective.example: We had a traditional Thanksgiving dinner with turkey and all the trimmings.
